name: The Caesar

reviews.title: Very Disapointed
reviews.text: quite disapointing, nothing like the glowing description on the web. halls are beaten up and the rugs are filthy. some websites describe the hotel as having air conditioned room, this is not the case. they have very limited amenities, and a shockingly casual approach to luggage security. coat hangers are aparently far too dear to supply more than 5 to a room.

reviews.title: Unhappy at the Caesar
reviews.text: I agree that the website completely misrepresents this hotel. My friend and I checked in to the smallest room I have ever seen after being treated quite rudely at the front desk. We arrived early and were handed a key to a small closet in which we could store our bags until check in. The closet was completely packed, and if not for the help of a fellow guest, we would not have been able to stow our bags. Our tiny room didn't even have enough space for our bags, and the french doors that look out to the courtyard had no lock. We promptly upgraded to a larger room, which we of course paid for. With the upgrade, we were to receive a free newspaper of our choice and a bottle of wine or water. The first day, we had neither and had to ask the front desk to ensure we got what we were paying for. The front desk staff were very rude, although the restaurant staff were pleasant. We discovered only by calling for room service on a Sunday night that the restaurant is closed on Sundays, even though the menu card in our room said the restaurant is open daily from 7-10pm. I would never stay at the Ceasar again although it is conveniently located.

reviews.title: we loved it!
reviews.text: My husband, mum and I stayed here in June and were panicking after reading the reviews here! However it exceeded our expectations! Ok the rooms are small, but they are immaculate and to be honest what can you expect for such a reasonable pirce in a great location? If you book, ask for a room at the front of the hotel - then you will have a big (opening) window. My mum was in a single at the top of the hotel at the back, and it was hot. The staff were all lovely and the bar was good. We will definitely stay here again as our stay was great!

reviews.title: Hugely Disapointed
reviews.text: I had already booked a double room for me and my girlfriend at The Caesar when she found this website and told me that it had bad reviews, i had a look and thought we should just give it a go as there's one guy who says it's a good place to stay. I won't make that mistake again.

reviews.title: Wouldn't stay again!!
reviews.text: Check in time is 2pm. I phoned up the day before to try and arrange an earlier check in but was told it was a little late but they'd do their best. I should imagine she put down the phone and did nothing about it as when we arrived at 1:30pm on the day the room wasn't ready and still wasn't ready until about 2:15. Ok not such a long wait really but seeing as i'd let my interest at checking in eaerly be known i would have thought a 4 star hotel would at least try and get the room ready.

reviews.title: Don't know why people are complaining
reviews.text: We left our bags in the small luggage room while we went for a walk in Hyde park to pass the time, the room is very small and packed to the brim with other peoples bags. I could have easily stolen some bags if i was that sort of person as they are literally just piled up.

reviews.title: Hated it
reviews.text: The corridors and the room we stayed in are carpetted in a grotty grey patterned carpet that looks about 20 years old, quite dirty in places too. Cardboard has been placed over certain bits where there's been spillages of some sort. The corridors themselves aren't the most attractive, infact they're not even straight, they weave around all over the place but that can't be helped as the building is probably very old.

reviews.title: Windows did't open & no A/C !!
reviews.text: When we arrived in our room i was amazed at how small it was. I can only remember staying in a travel lodge and that was much bigger as well as being better decorated. The walls in our room had scuff marks all over them. I wasn't even sure if we had an en-suite due to the size of the room, but there was one, about the length of a small bath each way. I can see this being difficult for larger people.

We stayed at the Caesar for one night and it was ok. Not much more than that. Not much worse than that. They were renovating at the time so the pokey lift only went to the third floor - we ended up using the stairs instead - seemed safer.
reviews.title: Good location but don't expect too much
Decent but Not to Write Home About
reviews.text: The room we got faced out to the street and was great. Most comfortable bed I've slept on for ages. Staff were also very friendly - we asked for an iron and some toiletries and they were almost instantaneously delivered.
We skipped the breakfast but a friend who also stayed there recently said it was great.
reviews.title: Average at best
You get what you pay for! Pokey rooms and too hot in the summer
reviews.text: It's a pretty good location not far back from Hyde Park but there's every chance you'll find better elsewhere.

reviews.title: Thought it was OK
reviews.text: I regularly stay at the Caesar when I travel to London on business. It is quite a bargain and hard to find a decent hotel at the prices they offer. The single rooms are very very (very) small and the room doors do not have double safety locks. The bathrooms are very clean. I have also stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend and the double rooms are equally as miniature as the single rooms. The hotel is in a very quiet area but there is a very lively street nearby with a shopping center and two tube stations. The 4th floor was under construction when I was there (Jan-Feb 05) and they really did a poor job at notifying guests that there would be noise and construction teams in the corridors early in the morning. If you don't plan to spend much time in the hotel room, want to save money and care about cleanliness, I would suggest this hotel. It's small but you get what you pay for. The staff come off as nice but completely clueless. I can't emphasize enough how small the rooms are so don't stay here if you expect spacious rooms!

reviews.title: good hotel
reviews.text: Good central location in Bayswater. Stayed one night in superior double room. Hotel had clearly been recently renovated. At least the hotel reception and our room were immaculate. Would stay again.

reviews.title: Give it a try!
reviews.text: Yes...what is all the complaining about!

reviews.title: How small are these rooms???
reviews.text: A Schrager Hotel, it is not! But for the price, who can complain?

reviews.title: Incredibly rude reception staff
reviews.text: As one of your other reviwers; I've stayed twice in the last several months and am upset I cannot get a room for my most recent trip.

Amenities are moderate to OK. Location is great with ideal proximity to Paddington and Heathrow Express. Rooms are clean and neat and are absolutely on par with most moderate European Hotels! What are most reviewers expecting?...travel a little more...get a broader perspective!
reviews.title: I would stay there again

description: The Caesar is one of the best lodging options in London. Located in a typical and recently remodelled Victorian building, its peaceful setting in a residential area and proximity to Paddington station and Hyde Park make it the perfect hotel for both leisure and business stays. It also has a charming restaurant and a bar where you can discover a bit about Spanish cuisine.
